intro: Cosmibuena holdridgei, commonly known as the Holdridge's cosmibuena, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a humid, tropical climate to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
